snippet: Officials say surviving fighters could go underground and exploit the economic and political vacuum, threatening not only the country but also its neighbors and possibly Europe....

byline.contributor: Declan Walsh contributed reporting from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: Officials say surviving fighters could go underground and exploit the economic and political vacuum, threatening not only the country but also its neighbors and possibly Europe.

headline.main: ISIS Remains Threat in Libya Despite Defeat in Surt, U.S. Officials Say
